description: A traditional&nbsp;Paloma is made with grapefruit soda, but this recipe combines&nbsp;mezcal and freshly squeezed pink juice to create an elegant yet refreshing twist. The honey brings out the floral flavors while salt balances them out for a hint of sweetness that you can enjoy anytime!
name: Frozen Mezcal Paloma
recipeIngredient: Lime wheel for garnish, sliced in half crosswise (optional)

recipeInstructions.name: Add grapefruit juice, lime juice, honey, mezcal, and salt to a resealable container. Shake to mix until all honey is dissolved.
recipeInstructions.text: Add grapefruit juice, lime juice, honey, mezcal, and salt to a resealable container. Shake to mix until all honey is dissolved.

recipeInstructions.name: Place in the freezer for 4 to 10 hours.
recipeInstructions.text: Place in the freezer for 4 to 10 hours.

recipeInstructions.name: Add mezcal mixture and ice to a blender when you're ready to serve. Blend until the right consistency is achieved and pour into two glasses.

recipeInstructions.name: If you like, garnish each glass with half a lime wheel.
